diseases.name: Migraine
diseases.description: A neurological condition characterized by intense, debilitating headaches.

diseases.name: Common Cold
diseases.description: A viral infection of the upper respiratory tract.

diseases.name: Bronchitis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the bronchial tubes, often following a respiratory infection.

diseases.name: Flu
diseases.description: An infectious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses.

diseases.name: COVID-19
diseases.description: A contagious disease caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus.

diseases.name: Diabetes
diseases.description: A chronic condition that affects how the body processes blood sugar (glucose).

diseases.name: Hypertension
diseases.description: A condition in which the force of the blood against the artery walls is too high.

diseases.name: Asthma
diseases.description: A condition in which your airways narrow and swell and may produce extra mucus.

diseases.name: Allergies
diseases.description: An immune system response to a foreign substance that's not typically harmful to your body.

diseases.name: Depression
diseases.description: A mood disorder that causes a persistent feeling of sadness and loss of interest.

diseases.name: Anxiety
diseases.description: A mental health disorder characterized by feelings of worry or fear that are strong enough to interfere with one's daily activities.

diseases.name: Schizophrenia
diseases.description: A serious mental disorder in which people interpret reality abnormally.

diseases.name: Bipolar Disorder
diseases.description: A disorder associated with episodes of mood swings ranging from depressive lows to manic highs.

diseases.name: Osteoarthritis
diseases.description: A type of arthritis that occurs when flexible tissue at the ends of bones wears down.

diseases.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
diseases.description: A chronic inflammatory disorder affecting many joints, including those in the hands and feet.

diseases.name: Gout
diseases.description: A form of arthritis characterized by severe pain, redness, and tenderness in joints.

diseases.name: Lupus
diseases.description: An inflammatory disease caused when the immune system attacks its own tissues.

diseases.name: Psoriasis
diseases.description: A skin disease marked by red, itchy, scaly patches.

diseases.name: Eczema
diseases.description: A condition that makes your skin red and itchy.

diseases.name: Chickenpox
diseases.description: A highly contagious viral infection causing an itchy, blister-like rash on the skin.

diseases.name: Measles
diseases.description: A viral infection that's serious for small children but is easily preventable by a vaccine.

diseases.name: Mumps
diseases.description: A viral infection that affects the salivary glands that's preventable by a vaccine.

diseases.name: Rubella
diseases.description: A contagious viral infection preventable by vaccine and best known by its distinctive red rash.

diseases.name: Polio
diseases.description: A virus that may cause paralysis and is easily preventable by the polio vaccine.

diseases.name: Tuberculosis
diseases.description: A potentially serious infectious bacterial disease that mainly affects the lungs.

diseases.name: HIV/AIDS
diseases.description: A virus that attacks the body's immune system and, if not treated, can lead to AIDS.

diseases.name: Hepatitis B
diseases.description: A serious liver infection caused by the hepatitis B virus that's easily preventable by a vaccine.

diseases.name: Hepatitis C
diseases.description: An infection caused by a virus that attacks the liver and leads to inflammation.

diseases.name: Cholera
diseases.description: A bacterial disease causing severe diarrhea and dehydration, usually spread in water.

diseases.name: Typhoid Fever
diseases.description: A bacterial infection due to Salmonella typhi that causes high fever and digestive symptoms.

diseases.name: Malaria
diseases.description: A mosquito-borne infectious disease affecting humans and other animals.

diseases.name: Dengue Fever
diseases.description: A mosquito-borne viral infection causing a severe flu-like illness.

diseases.name: Zika Virus
diseases.description: A disease caused by the Zika virus that's spread through mosquito bites.

diseases.name: Yellow Fever
diseases.description: A viral infection spread by a particular species of mosquito.

diseases.name: Lyme Disease
diseases.description: A tick-borne illness caused by the bacterium Borrelia burgdorferi.

diseases.name: Ebola Virus
diseases.description: A rare and deadly virus that causes severe bleeding, organ failure, and can lead to death.

diseases.name: Meningitis
diseases.description: An inflammation of the membranes (meninges) surrounding your brain and spinal cord.

diseases.name: Encephalitis
diseases.description: An inflammation of the brain, often due to infection.

diseases.name: Tetanus
diseases.description: A serious bacterial infection that causes painful muscle spasms and can lead to death.

diseases.name: Rabies
diseases.description: A deadly virus spread to people from the saliva of infected animals.

diseases.name: Anthrax
diseases.description: A rare but serious bacterial illness.

diseases.name: Syphilis
diseases.description: A bacterial infection usually spread by sexual contact that starts as a painless sore.

diseases.name: Gonorrhea
diseases.description: A sexually transmitted bacterial infection that, if untreated, may cause infertility.

diseases.name: Chlamydia
diseases.description: A common sexually transmitted infection that may not cause symptoms.

diseases.name: Trichomoniasis
diseases.description: A sexually transmitted infection caused by a parasite.

diseases.name: Genital Herpes
diseases.description: A common sexually transmitted infection marked by genital pain and sores.

diseases.name: HPV
diseases.description: A viral infection that's passed between people through skin-to-skin contact.

diseases.name: Candidiasis
diseases.description: A fungal infection typically on the skin or mucous membranes caused by candida.

diseases.name: Mononucleosis
diseases.description: An infectious disease marked by increased numbers of mononuclear leukocytes and enlarged cervical lymph nodes.

diseases.name: Pneumonia
diseases.description: An infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs.

diseases.name: Tuberculosis
diseases.description: A potentially serious infectious bacterial disease that mainly affects the lungs.

diseases.name: Emphysema
diseases.description: A lung condition that causes shortness of breath.

diseases.name: Chronic Bronchitis
diseases.description: A form of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) characterized by a chronic cough.

diseases.name: Lung Cancer
diseases.description: A type of cancer that begins in the lungs.

diseases.name: Prostate Cancer
diseases.description: A cancer in a man's prostate, a small walnut-sized gland that produces seminal fluid.

diseases.name: Breast Cancer
diseases.description: A cancer that forms in the cells of the breasts.

diseases.name: Colorectal Cancer
diseases.description: A cancer that starts in the colon or the rectum.

diseases.name: Melanoma
diseases.description: A type of skin cancer that develops from the pigment-producing cells known as melanocytes.

diseases.name: Leukemia
diseases.description: A cancer of blood-forming tissues, hindering the body's ability to fight infection.

diseases.name: Lymphoma
diseases.description: A cancer of the lymphatic system.

diseases.name: Salmonellosis
diseases.description: An infection caused by Salmonella bacteria, often through contaminated food or water.

diseases.name: Campylobacteriosis
diseases.description: An infection caused by Campylobacter bacteria, commonly through undercooked poultry or contaminated water.

diseases.name: E. coli Infection
medication: Avoidance of antibiotics (as they may worsen symptoms)
diseases.description: An infection caused by Escherichia coli bacteria, often through contaminated food or water.

diseases.name: Norovirus Infection
diseases.description: A highly contagious virus causing gastroenteritis, often spread through contaminated food or surfaces.

diseases.name: Listeriosis
diseases.description: A serious infection caused by Listeria bacteria, commonly found in contaminated food such as unpasteurized dairy products.

diseases.name: Alopecia Areata
symptoms: hair loss in small, round patches on the scalp
hair loss on other parts of the body
diseases.description: An autoimmune disorder that causes hair to fall out in small patches.

diseases.name: Hypothyroidism
diseases.description: A condition in which the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormones.

diseases.name: Hyperthyroidism
diseases.description: A condition in which the thyroid gland produces too much thyroid hormone.

diseases.name: Lupus
diseases.description: An autoimmune disease where the immune system attacks its own tissues, causing widespread inflammation and tissue damage.

diseases.name: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS)
diseases.description: A hormonal disorder causing enlarged ovaries with small cysts on the outer edges.

diseases.name: Sepsis
diseases.description: A life-threatening condition that arises when the body's response to infection causes injury to its own tissues and organs.

diseases.name: Sinusitis
diseases.description: An inflammation or swelling of the tissue lining the sinuses, which can be caused by infections or allergies.

diseases.name: Allergic Rhinitis (Hay Fever)
diseases.description: An allergic reaction that causes sneezing, congestion, and a runny nose.

diseases.name: Respiratory Syncytial Virus (RSV) Infection
diseases.description: A common respiratory virus that usually causes mild, cold-like symptoms.

diseases.name: Conjunctivitis (Pink Eye)
diseases.description: An inflammation or infection of the conjunctiva, the clear tissue that lines the inside of the eyelid and covers the white part of the eye.

diseases.name: Uveitis
diseases.description: An inflammation of the uvea, the middle layer of the eye, which can cause swelling and damage to eye tissues.

diseases.name: Blepharitis
diseases.description: An inflammation of the eyelids that affects the eyelashes or tear production.

diseases.name: Keratitis
medication: Antibacterial, antifungal, or antiviral eye drops (depending on cause)
diseases.description: An inflammation of the cornea, the clear, dome-shaped tissue on the front of the eye.

diseases.name: Glaucoma
diseases.description: A group of eye conditions that damage the optic nerve, often due to high eye pressure, leading to vision loss.

diseases.name: Dry Eye Syndrome
symptoms: feeling of something in the eye
diseases.description: A condition where the eyes do not produce enough tears or the tears evaporate too quickly, leading to dryness and irritation.

diseases.name: Iritis
diseases.description: An inflammation of the iris, the colored part of the eye, which can cause pain and vision problems.

diseases.name: Otitis Media
diseases.description: An infection of the middle ear, common in children, often following a respiratory infection.

diseases.name: Labyrinthitis
diseases.description: An inner ear infection or inflammation that affects the labyrinth, which can lead to vertigo and hearing loss.

diseases.name: Vitamin B12 Deficiency
diseases.description: A deficiency in vitamin B12 can cause a range of symptoms, including neurological issues and taste disturbances.

diseases.name: COVID-19
diseases.description: A viral infection caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, affecting the respiratory system and causing a wide range of symptoms.

diseases.name: Oral Thrush (Candidiasis)
symptoms: white patches on the tongue or inner cheeks
diseases.description: A fungal infection in the mouth caused by Candida species, commonly seen in infants, older adults, and immunocompromised individuals.

diseases.name: Aphthous Stomatitis (Canker Sores)
symptoms: small, round, white or yellow sores with a red edge
diseases.description: Small, painful ulcers that occur inside the mouth, often triggered by stress, injury, or certain foods.

diseases.name: Hand, Foot, and Mouth Disease
symptoms: painful red blisters on the tongue, gums, and inside of the cheeks
rash on the hands and feet
diseases.description: A contagious viral infection common in young children, characterized by sores in the mouth and a rash on the hands and feet.

diseases.name: Scalp Psoriasis
diseases.description: A common skin disorder that causes raised, reddish, scaly patches, often on the scalp.

diseases.name: Parkinson's Disease
diseases.description: A disorder of the central nervous system that affects movement, often including tremors.

diseases.name: Alzheimer's Disease
diseases.description: A progressive disease that destroys memory and other important mental functions.

diseases.name: Multiple Sclerosis
diseases.description: A disease in which the immune system eats away at the protective covering of nerves.

diseases.name: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis
diseases.description: A nervous system disease that weakens muscles and impacts physical function.

diseases.name: Epilepsy
diseases.description: A disorder in which nerve cell activity in the brain is disturbed, causing seizures.

diseases.name: Cerebral Palsy
diseases.description: A group of disorders that affect movement and muscle tone or posture.

diseases.name: Stroke
diseases.description: A condition in which poor blood flow to the brain results in cell death.

diseases.name: Myasthenia Gravis
diseases.description: A chronic autoimmune neuromuscular disease that causes weakness in the skeletal muscles.

diseases.name: Celiac Disease
diseases.description: An immune reaction to eating gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye.

diseases.name: Crohn's Disease
diseases.description: A chronic inflammatory bowel disease that affects the lining of the digestive tract.

diseases.name: Ulcerative Colitis
diseases.description: A chronic, inflammatory bowel disease that causes inflammation in the digestive tract.

diseases.name: Stress-related Musculoskeletal Pain
diseases.description: A musculoskeletal disorder characterized by symptoms such as back pain and muscle tension, often worsened by increased stress levels.

diseases.name: Stress-induced Headache Disorder
diseases.description: A headache disorder characterized by various types of headaches such as tension-type headaches, migraines, and cluster headaches, often triggered or worsened by increased stress levels.

diseases.name: Stress-induced Hypertension
diseases.description: A condition where stress triggers or exacerbates high blood pressure.

diseases.name: Stress-related Gastrointestinal Disorder
diseases.description: A gastrointestinal disorder characterized by symptoms such as abdominal pain and bloating, often exacerbated by increased stress levels.

diseases.name: Anxiety Disorders
diseases.description: A group of mental health disorders characterized by feelings of anxiety and fear, often triggered by stress.

diseases.name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome
diseases.description: A common disorder affecting the large intestine.

diseases.name: Peptic Ulcer
diseases.description: Open sores that develop on the inside lining of your stomach and the upper portion of your small intestine.

diseases.name: Gallstones
diseases.description: Hardened deposits of digestive fluid that can form in your gallbladder.

diseases.name: Pancreatitis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the pancreas.

diseases.name: Hepatitis A
diseases.description: A highly contagious liver infection caused by the hepatitis A virus.

diseases.name: Hepatitis B
diseases.description: A serious liver infection caused by the hepatitis B virus that's easily preventable by a vaccine.

diseases.name: Hepatitis C
diseases.description: An infection caused by a virus that attacks the liver and leads to inflammation.

diseases.name: Cirrhosis
diseases.description: Chronic liver damage from a variety of causes leading to scarring and liver failure.

diseases.name: Alcoholic Liver Disease
diseases.description: Damage to the liver and its function due to alcohol abuse.

diseases.name: Kidney Stones
diseases.description: Hard deposits made of minerals and salts that form inside your kidneys.

diseases.name: Chronic Kidney Disease
diseases.description: The gradual loss of kidney function.

diseases.name: Urinary Tract Infection
diseases.description: An infection in any part of your urinary system.

diseases.name: Interstitial Cystitis
diseases.description: A chronic condition causing bladder pressure, bladder pain and sometimes pelvic pain.

diseases.name: Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia
diseases.description: Age-associated prostate gland enlargement that can cause urination difficulty.

diseases.name: Prostatitis
diseases.description: Swelling and inflammation of the prostate gland.

diseases.name: Urinary Incontinence
diseases.description: Loss of bladder control.

diseases.name: Hypothyroidism
diseases.description: A condition in which the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormone.

diseases.name: Hyperthyroidism
diseases.description: The overproduction of a hormone by the butterfly-shaped gland in the neck (thyroid).

diseases.name: Diabetes Type 1
diseases.description: A chronic condition in which the pancreas produces little or no insulin.

diseases.name: Diabetes Type 2
diseases.description: A chronic condition that affects the way the body processes blood sugar (glucose).

diseases.name: Cushing's Syndrome
diseases.description: A condition that occurs from exposure to high cortisol levels for a long time.

diseases.name: Addison's Disease
diseases.description: A disorder in which the adrenal glands don't produce enough hormones.

diseases.name: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome
diseases.description: A hormonal disorder causing enlarged ovaries with small cysts on the outer edges.

diseases.name: Endometriosis
diseases.description: A disorder in which tissue similar to the tissue that normally lines the inside of your uterus grows outside your uterus.

diseases.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
diseases.description: A chronic inflammatory disorder affecting many joints, including those in the hands and feet.

diseases.name: Osteoarthritis
diseases.description: A type of arthritis that occurs when flexible tissue at the ends of bones wears down.

diseases.name: Gout
diseases.description: A form of arthritis characterized by severe pain, redness, and tenderness in joints.

diseases.name: Lupus
diseases.description: An inflammatory disease caused when the immune system attacks its own tissues.

diseases.name: Fibromyalgia
diseases.description: A disorder characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain accompanied by fatigue, sleep, memory, and mood issues.
